resources.string: Draw any card from the edge of the field

Cats in squares is a two player game in which two cats fight for their master's attention and affection. 
The playing field consists of 16 cards displaying different places of the master's house with various cat stuff. 

 House locations: window, floor, yard, heater
 Cat stuff: bowl, mouse, cat bed, carrier.

The aim of the game is to meet one of the three victory conditions: 

 1. Completely fill a vertical or horizontal row on the playing field with 4 cat cards of your color. 
2. Form a 2x2 square on the playing field with 4 cat cards of your color. 
3. Fill the playing field with cat cards so that the opponent cannot make another move.

How to play:\n The first player draws any card from the edge of the field, i.e. four cards from the center of the field may not be played on the first move. The card drawn from the field determines the further actions of the second player. Now the second player can only draw the card on which the location of the house or the cat\'s stuff matches the place or cat\'s stuff displayed on the card drawn by the first player. The newly drawn card now determines the further actions of the first player. \nThe game continues until one of players meets one of victory conditions.
The field does not match the condition

Graphic design: 
 
 	 Cards: Romanov Vladimir. Instagram: @art.romanovvlm 
 
 	 Cards, background: Ivanova Alina 
 
 	 Old design version: Gordienko Irina

Translation:
